DOC.brief_title: Multi-Markers In Diagnosis Acute Coronary Syndrome
DOC.detailed_description: This prospective , multi-center , observational , sample procurement study adult subject present Emergency Department ( ED ) ACS differential diagnosis . Subjects must present one participate EDs within 6 hour less time symptom onset , must experience least 5 minute chest discomfort . Those ED patient possible ACS meet inclusion/exclusion criterion approach study enrollment train research personnel . The patient 's diagnostic work-up treatment continue per standard treat institution . As indicated clinical presentation , anticipated patient study electrocardiogram ( ECG ) upon admission ED patient find ST-elevation myocardial infarction ( STEMI ) , objective cardiac test conduct evidence MI . The Principal Investigator site evaluate result objective cardiac test combine biomarker evidence myocardial necrosis determine whether patient enrol site final diagnosis ACS . Cardiac event procedure , angioplasty-stenting coronary artery bypass surgery ( CABG ) , record index ED visit , hospitalization post-hospital follow-up period . Subjects 30-day , 3 month 6 month follow-up contact phone medical chart review collect information cardiac event , procedure survival . Blood sample collect several time point index ED visit use future test novel blood marker become available .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Patient 18 year age old time enrollment . 2 . Patient present ED within 6 hour onset symptom consistent ACS . 3 . Subject present least one symptom outline : 1 . Chest discomfort least 5 minute duration time symptom onset . Episodic stutter chest discomfort acceptable last episode precede ED presentation within 6 hour symptom onset . 2 . Chest discomfort shorter duration due pharmacologic intervention . 3 . Ischemic Equivalent , Chest Pain Syndrome , Anginal Equivalent , Ischemic ECG Abnormalities . 4 . Physician plan perform objective cardiac testing define protocol Section 3.2 . 1 . Patient ( Legal Representative ) unable unwilling provide inform consent . 2 . Patient ( Legal Representative ) refusal telephone followup medical record review 30 day , 90 day 180 day postED presentation . 3 . Patient ( Legal Representative ) refusal multiple blood sample collection study period .
